Title: Associate / Senior Analyst – Reporting & Analytics
Description:
About the company

Phoenix Search has partnered with a renowned venture capital firm with a strong presence in technology-enabled industries such as e-commerce, fintech, mobility, gaming, and AI. With a global presence, they have a successful track record of 30 years in the industry. The firm is

committed to driving innovation and growth through strategic investments and exceptional portfolio management.




The opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Analyst/Associate to enhance the Reporting &

Analytics function within the Operations Team. This role is pivotal in

driving efficiencies and fostering data-driven decision-making across

the firm. The ideal candidate will have a passion for global financial

markets, an analytical mindset, and thrive in a dynamic environment.




If you are ready to contribute to a high-performing team and make an

impact through your analytical skills, this could be the perfect

opportunity for you.




Responsibilities

Analyse the architecture and relationships within investment and reporting systems.
Prepare quarterly reports, capital account statements, and fund dashboards.
Review financial statements and cash flows for consistency with deliverables.
Support portfolio company valuations through rigorous analysis.
Lead quantitative and qualitative analyses to derive insights.
Synthesise portfolio performance data to aid in year-end fund audits.
Identify and implement continuous improvements to enhance reporting efficiency.
Address ad-hoc requests from both internal and external stakeholders.




Requirements

Degree qualified (Bachelor’s or Master’s) in finance, economics, engineering, or business.
Strong Excel skills and solid understanding of financial accounting principles.
Familiarity with databases (SQL a plus); MacOS experience is beneficial.
Detail-oriented, motivated, and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a critical eye for process improvement.

Title: Merchandising Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler® and Lee®. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What’s the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst


Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.


Skills For Success


A Bachelor’s degree and 3–5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal; additional European languages are a plus.
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.


We Offer

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.

Benefits And Perks Include


Competitive salary package
Discounts on Wrangler® & Lee® brands
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company


Why Kontoor Brands?

At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family’s needs – now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.
Show more

Title: Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist
Description:
Switzerland

Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist

Organization


Médecins Sans Frontières en Suisse


Posted 30 Jul 2025 Closing date 17 Aug 2025

Job Offer

(strictly no recruitment agencies)

Join MSF OCG as a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist!

We are looking for passionate candidates ready to contribute to our humanitarian mission.

Below, you will find the job details and the qualifications we are looking for.

Inclusivity and Diversity at MSF

Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don’t fulfil every listed qualification.

We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Context & mission

Médecins Sans Frontières is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).

The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? At MSF Switzerland, we're looking for a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist to play a key role in shaping our self-service data platform and enterprise reporting.

In this role, you’ll wear two hats. First, as a Business Analyst, you’ll work closely with different departments to understand their reporting needs, listening, analyzing, and documenting requirements to ensure we’re solving the right problems. Then, you’ll switch gears and become our Power BI expert, building intuitive reports, clean datasets, and powerful semantic models using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.

You won’t be working in isolation. You’ll be a vital part of a cross-functional project team alongside our Data Architect, Data Engineers, and key stakeholders, you will be part of the BRIDGE (Bringing Resources & Intelligence for Dynamic Global Engagement) project team, integrated to the DIP (Data, Innovation and Project) section, which is part of the DSI (Direction of the Systems of Information).

You’ll help make sure everything we build aligns with both business goals and our data governance standards, thus influencing the adoption of the new dashboards.

If you're ready to dive into a meaningful data journey and make a real difference through your work, we’d love to hear from you.

Fixed-term contract for 12 months, with potential for renewal based on evolving project requirements.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Business Needs Collection: Collect, analyze, and structure reporting needs across departments and domains.
Requirements Documentation: Translate business requirements into documented reporting specifications and data needs.
Request Prioritization: Prioritize and organize reporting requests and ensure traceability from request to solution.
Governed Reporting Design: Participate in the design and evolution of a governed reporting environment using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
Report & Dashboard Implementation: Build and deploy interactive, user-friendly reports and dashboards tailored to business objectives.
Certified Dataset Development: Develop and maintain certified, reusable datasets aligned with enterprise data standards.
Content Documentation: Document reporting content, usage guidelines, and data logic to ensure transparency and consistency.
User Support & Training: Actively contribute to user onboarding, training, and support for self-service data tools.


Your profile

Education


Tertiary degree, university degree, or equivalent in data analytics, information systems, business intelligence, or a related field
Certifications in Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, or related tools are an asset


Experience


You have at least 4 years of experience in roles that blend business analysis with data-focused project delivery.
You’re confident translating complex business questions into clear, impactful reporting solutions.
You’ve had hands-on involvement in BI development—building datasets and contributing to dashboards.


Languages


English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).


Skills/ Technical competencies

Business Analysis


Gather and structure reporting requirements from multiple business domains
Translate operational and analytical needs into functional specifications
Ensure alignment between business needs and existing data capabilities


Power BI & Data Platform


Build and maintain interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
Design and manage reusable datasets and semantic models in Power BI and support data quality
Leverage Microsoft Fabric, Pw BI platform for modelling, orchestration, and platform integration


Governance, Documentation, And Enablement


Align reporting solutions with enterprise data governance and architecture
Document all deliverables (datasets, visuals, business rules, KPIs, usage)
Contribute to user onboarding, training sessions, and guidance material
Ensure consistency and clarity in metrics and data definitions across reports


Collaboration & Contribution


Work as part of a broader data project team, supporting implementation milestones
Collaborate with the Data Architect, Data Engineers, and business stakeholders
Support cross-functional testing, feedback cycles, and continuous improvement


Terms of employment


Full-time position 100% (40h/week)
Fixed-term contract, 12 months
Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
Ideal start date: 15th of September 2025
Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 94’440.- to CHF 108’348.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.


How to apply

Candidates are invited to submit their application exclusively through our recruitment platform, following these guidelines:


CV (maximum 2 pages)
Cover letter (maximum 1 page)
Documents must be submitted in either English or French.


The application deadline is 17th August 2025

We reserve the right to close this vacancy earlier if we receive a sufficient number of quality applications.

APPLY

All applications will be treated confidentially.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

Job details

Country


Switzerland


City Geneva Source


Médecins Sans Frontières en Suisse


Type


Job


Career category


Information Management


Years of experience


5-9 years


Share


Share this on Facebook
Share this on X
Post this on LinkedIn

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
Qui nous sommes




SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :




> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

> Un système qualité performant

> Des services adaptables et évolutifs




Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.







Missions




Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.







Profil




5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.







Informations complémentaires




Date de début : dès que possible
Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
Durée : Long terme
Langue : Français et anglais
Nationalité européenne requise
Show more

  • Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.



Profil


  • 5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
  • Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
  • Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
  • Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
  • Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
  • Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
  • Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
  • Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.



Informations complémentaires


  • Date de début : dès que possible
  • Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
  • Durée : Long terme
  • Langue : Français et anglais
  • Nationalité européenne requise

Title: (Junior) Consultant
Description:
Du bist ein Young Professional und suchst eine Herausforderung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Marktforschung und Unternehmensberatung als:




(Junior) Consultant




Pensum: 100 Prozent Stellenantritt: nach Vereinbarung


Aufgaben



Betreuung von Forschungs- und Beratungsmandaten über alle Phasen des Projekt-managements


Durchführung von Workshops


Erstellen von Kunden- und Marktanalysen


Teilnahme bei Kundenmeetings


Unterstützung bei der Kundengewinnung



Qualifikation



Masterabschluss in Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften

(Universität oder Fachhochschule)


Zahlenaffin und Kompetenzen in empirischen Methoden sowie R-/R-Stuio-Kenntnisse


Sicheres Auftreten und gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch


Hohes Engagement, belastbar und effiziente Arbeitsweise


Erste Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marktforschung, Beratung oder Marketing von Vorteil



Benefits



Professionelles Consulting-Umfeld auf anspruchsvollem, internationalem Niveau mit namhaften Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Wirtschaftsbranchen


Kleines, dynamisches Team im Zürcher Technopark – vernetzt mit Spezialist:innen in der DACH-Region


Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitseinteilung mit Möglichkeit von Home Office


Einblicke in das gesamte Unternehmen


Offenes und entspanntes Arbeitsklima, wo eigene Ideen auf Resonanz stossen.





Wir sind ein international tätiges Beratungs- und Researchunternehmen, spezialisiert auf eine effiziente und effektive Marktbearbeitung. Wir verknüpfen Zielgruppen, Touchpoints und Inhalte und holen so messbar das Maximum aus den Investitionen unserer Auftraggeber.




Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Title: Consultant Data Analysis - Zurich
Description:
EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.

In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world’s capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients’ businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.

Your Key Responsibilities


Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.


You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.

To qualify for the role you must have


A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proficiency in German and English.


More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world’s leading professional services firms.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Take the next step and apply for this position online.

Title: Palantir Specialist
Description:
ALTEN Group

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.




ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland’s activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.




____________




Join ALTEN Switzerland as a Palantir Specialist and take on the challenge of designing, configuring and managing advanced data solutions using Palantir Foundry for a key client in the financial sector.




Key Responsibilities

Configure and maintain Palantir platforms to meet evolving business needs;
Develop custom data models, dashboards and workflows for advanced analytics;
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate requirements into effective solutions;
Train and support end-users to maximize platform adoption and value.




Your profile

Hands-on experience with Palantir Foundry;
Strong skills in data engineering and data analysis;
Familiarity with AI and machine learning is preferred;
Fluent English is required; German language skills are a plus;
Background in engineering, computer science or related fields is preferred.




Location: Canton of Zurich (on-site with hybrid flexibility).




What we offer you

At ALTEN, you benefit from a permanent contract, access to cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients and opportunities for both national and international growth. We support your development with certified trainings in technical and soft skills.




Apply now and grow with us – we believe in building the future together!




___

ALTEN Switzerland AG

Hardturmstrasse 11

8005 Zürich

Tel. +41 (0) 79 103 45 63

__

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nous ouvrons un poste de Data Analyst pour renforcer l’équipe de notre client basé à Lausanne.




Responsabilités du poste

Concevoir et développer des visualisations de données adaptées aux besoins des services utilisateurs, en cohérence avec l’environnement technique défini.

Collaborer activement au sein de l’équipe Données et participer aux réunions et rituels Agile.

Travailler en coordination avec les projets, l’architecture d’entreprise et les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin d’assurer la cohérence des solutions et leur fiabilité opérationnelle.

Garantir une modélisation efficace et pertinente des données exploitées.

Assurer la qualité des données collectées et veiller à leur documentation rigoureuse.

Maintenir un dialogue constant avec les utilisateurs et utilisatrices afin d’assurer une expérience utilisateur optimale.

Être moteur dans les propositions d’amélioration continue des processus et des outils.

Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques de datavisualisation au sein des équipes et accompagner leur adoption.


Prérequis

Diplôme en informatique d'une haute école (HES, université, EPF) ou titre jugé équivalent.

Expérience professionnelle d’au moins 3 ans dans la mise en œuvre de projets de visualisation de données.

Maîtrise avérée du mode de travail Agile dans le cadre de projets IT.

Bonne connaissance des outils de datavisualisation tels que Tableau et des outils SIG (comme Geoserver).

Compétences techniques en GitLab, VSCode, Docker, Python, DBT et autres ETL.

Connaissance des sources de données variées : Parquet (S3), PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Arrow, GeoJson, etc.

Expérience avec des outils d’ordonnancement comme Prefect.

Notions d’ITIL et de la méthodologie HERMES appréciées, ainsi qu'une expérience antérieure dans le secteur public.


Rejoindre Sword, c’est…
💼 Formation continue : Un budget formation qui croit tous les mois à utiliser dans un large catalogue de formation
🏝 25 jours de congés payés : Tous nos employés ont droit à 25 jours de congés payés par an
🚑 Une couverture assurance-accident internationale
🎉 Evènements réguliers : Des événements mensuels pour se retrouver en petit ou grand comité
🌍 Environnements internationaux : Des missions dans des groupes d'envergure internationale
🛠 Innovation : Contribuez à des projets impactants et innovants dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité
🎁 Des petits plaisirs : Nos employés bénéficient d'un programme d'avantages et remises très intéressantes

Title: FINANCE DATA SENIOR ANALYST
Description:
BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.

This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-Gâne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:


Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies


University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus


Personal, Methodological And Social Skills


High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Excellent communication skills
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.


YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg




Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!







So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.




Deine Hauptaufgaben:

Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.




Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil







Optionale Superkräfte:

Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus




🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Show more
HTML:
Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkräfte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus


🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:


EU / EEA citizenship
Must be graduating within or after November 2025


These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let’s talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.


What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?


Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Competences Required:


Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.


A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:


The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.


What’s In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential—fueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people—you can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:


Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership


In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands


Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Zürich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months


Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines


Month 3-4


Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.


Month 5-onwards


Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.


Qualifications


A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information


This position offers Hybrid working conditions and is subject to change at any time.
Candidate is required to work in the Zürich office 4 days per week with 1 day being remote.
This position does not offer Visa Sponsorship opportunities.


Friendly, personable and often surprisingly uncomplicated, that's how many of our employees describe their working relationships at Sika. We call this the Sika Spirit

We offer a fair employment package with good social benefits

We look forward to your direct online application.
Show more

Title: Laboranten - (Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%
Description:
Aufgrund des stetigen Wachstums unseres Unternehmens und zur Verstärkung unseres bioanalytischen Labors in Fehraltorf/Zürich suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung mehrere engagierte Persönlichkeiten als

(Senior) Analyst LBS oder LC-MS 100%

Wir bieten Dir

Eine verantwortungsvolle Arbeit in einem offenen und dynamischen Team

On the job Weiterbildung und Entwicklung

Vielseitige Mitarbeit in unterschiedlichen Projekten

Moderne Infrastruktur

Work-Life-Balance: flexible Arbeitszeiten (Mo bis Fr, keine Wochenenden, keine Schicht), mind. 5 Wochen Ferien

Finanzielles: Lohngleichheit zwischen den Geschlechtern, sehr gute Sozialleistungen, Bezug von REKA-Checks

Das bringst Du mit

Chemielaborant/in, Biologielaborant/in, CTA, BTA oder MTA

Erfahrung in der Aufbereitung biologischen Probenmaterials

Sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Biochemie und/oder Chromatographie / Massenspektrometrie

Exakte Arbeitsweise bei praktischer Arbeit und Dokumentation

Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Erfahrung im regulierten Umfeld (GxP / ISO) wäre super, ist aber nicht Voraussetzung

Das erwartet Dich bei uns

Messung pharmazeutischer Wirkstoffe in biologischen Proben mittels Immunoassay basierten oder LC-MS Methoden in einem GLP-zertifizierten Labor

Durchführung von (bio)analytischen Methodenvalidierungen sowie deren Anwendung in Rahmen von präklinischen und klinischen Studien inklusive Auswertung

Planung, Durchführung und Dokumentation von (bio)analytischen Prüfungen im Rahmen der Arzneimittelentwicklung

Organisatorische Aufgaben rund um das Labor

LC-MS Labor: Probenaufarbeitung inkl. Bedienung von LC-MS/MS Systemen und Durchführung von System-Tests

Noch Fragen? Dein Ansprechpartner Iris Rüttimann (HR Manager) steht Dir dafür gerne unter 043 355 7676 zur Verfügung.

Wäre das was für Dich? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inkl. CV, Zeugnisse, Diplome, usw.

Title: Quantitative Researcher Intern
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 21 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda's primary offices are located in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Quantitative Researcher Intern to join the Quantitative Investment Research team in Geneva or Zug, for 4-8 months starting in 2025. The candidate will support portfolio managers, help implement solutions for trading and risk systems, and in the course of the internship be exposed to the analytics used in trading while working closely with a mentor for guidance and feedback.

Position Responsibilities


Assist in the development of data driven strategies to complement investment decisions.
Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, back-testing, and performance monitoring.
Conduct an original research project over the duration of the internship.


Qualifications & Desired Skills


Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline.
Exceptional quantitative & programming skills (Python & SQL).
Knowledge and interest in financial markets.
Strong communication skills.
Ability to work independently.
Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.


Candidate Privacy Policy
Show more

  • Strong communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve.

Candidate Privacy Policy

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us with data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language. Experience with Data frame libraries (Polars, Pandas, Arrow, ...), and database toolkits (SQL Alchemy, ...).
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Knowledge of data engineering concepts and open-source ecosystem (Airflow, DBT, DuckDB, ...).
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Knowledge of semantic or hybrid search engines is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills. Desire to learn, explore, discover new concepts and technologies.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
🎯 Mission




Nous recherchons un Data Engineer pour travailler sur la conception, le développement et le maintien de pipelines sur Databricks et AWS.







🛠️ Responsabilités principales




Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données robustes sur Databricks.

Optimiser les workflows de données et garantir leur disponibilité, performance et intégrité.

Collaborer avec les équipes Cloud et Frontend pour unifier les sources de données.

Analyser les performances de la plateforme, détecter les points de friction et proposer des améliorations.

Assurer une documentation technique claire et rigoureuse des process ETL.







🎓 Profil recherché




🧠 Compétences techniques requises




5 ans d'expérience minimum en tant que Data Engineer, dont une expérience significative sur Databricks.

Maîtrise de PySpark, SQL, Python.

Une première expérience sur AWS.

Excellentes compétences analytiques et esprit de synthèse.

Une expérience dans le domaine de l’énergie ou du trading est un plus.







📌 Informations complémentaires




📍 Lieu de travail : Suisse (résidence en Suisse non obligatoire)

🧑 💼 Expérience : Confirmé

💼 Télétravail : 1 à 2 jours par semaine







🗣️ Langues :




Français : Courant

Anglais : Opérationnel (B1/B2)

Title: Business Analyst Data Domain – Customer Solutions
Description:
Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Intégré au sein de notre département du Data Office, votre mission principale sera d’analyser les besoins opérationnels d’optimisation des processus pour notre Domain Customer, afin de les traduire en spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques précises. Dans ce cadre-là :


Vous étudierez et représenterez les processus métiers de votre périmètre, en mettant en lumière les dysfonctionnements, les points de blocage et les risques. À partir de cette analyse, vous formulerez des recommandations concrètes dans le cadre d’un plan d’amélioration continue.
Vous recueillerez, prioriserez et documenterez les besoins d’évolution, en menant des entretiens approfondis avec les parties prenantes. Vous évaluerez l’impact, l’urgence, la complexité, la faisabilité et la valeur ajoutée de chaque demande en élaborant des business cases détaillés.
Vous définirez les spécifications fonctionnelles en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers et techniques en participant activement au choix des solutions technologiques les plus pertinentes et en accompagnant les décisions stratégiques.
Vous participerez à la mise en œuvre des projets, en coordonnant les efforts d’intégration et de migration des solutions dans le SI existant. En parallèle, vous définirez des procédures d’assurance qualité et des indicateurs de performance pour mesurer l’efficacité des solutions déployées.
Vous suivrez l’avancement des projets, apporterez votre expertise pour résoudre les situations complexes, participerez aux phases de tests (recettage), et accompagnerez les utilisateurs dans l’adoption des nouveaux outils et processus.
Vous mesurerez l’impact des projets sur les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI) afin de vérifier l’atteinte des objectifs et du retour sur investissement.
Enfin, vous assurerez un reporting régulier auprès de votre hiérarchie et veillerez à maintenir une documentation claire, structurée et à jour, afin de faciliter le partage des connaissances et garantir la continuité des opérations.


Qualifications


Au bénéfice d’un diplôme supérieur dans le domaine de l’IT, vous justifiez d’une expérience significative sur un poste similaire dans le domaine du luxe.
Des expériences préalables sur Salesforce et Google Analytics sont un atout.
Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et l’anglais.
Autonome et rigoureux, vous êtes reconnu pour votre polyvalence et votre sens de responsabilité.
Vous êtes doté d’une bonne capacité d'écoute et avez de la facilité à communiquer avec vos interlocuteurs.
Enfin, vous êtes reconnu pour votre esprit d’analyse, votre force de proposition et votre organisation.


Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :


La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
Un restaurant d’entreprise
Une LPP avantageuse


Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID:19187

Title: Gestionnaire de Données de Stocks / Master Data Analyst
Description:
Gestionnaire de Données de Stocks / Master Data Analyst




Dans un contexte de transformation, notre client du secteur industriel recherche un(e) Gestionnaire de Données de Stocks / Master Data Analyst pour structurer, fiabiliser et piloter la gestion du cycle de vie des données produits.




Votre rôle :

Véritable point de contact entre les équipes métiers (Supply, Production, Maintenance) et les équipes IT, vous serez garant(e) de la qualité et de la cohérence des données diverses : articles, stocks, fournisseurs, …

Vous intervenez sur la création, la mise à jour, le nettoyage, la migration des données et participerez à l’optimisation des processus.

Vous travaillez en transversal avec les fonctions opérationnelles et informatiques, pilotez la refonte d’outils internes, définissez des KPIs qualité et contribuez activement à l’amélioration continue.

Vous assurez également la gestion administrative liée à la logistique, aux achats et au suivi documentaire, en lien avec les opérations de la société.




Votre profil :

Bachelor (gestion industrielle, data management, Supply Chain)
3 ans d’expérience en environnement industriel
Vous maîtrisez les outils IT en tant qu’utilisateur avancé : ERP (SAP), requêtes SQL, Excel (niveau avancé) et idéalement Power BI pour l’analyse et le reporting.
Bilingue Français / Anglais




Informations complémentaires :

Taux d’occupation à 100%
5 jours par semaine sur site (pas de home office)
Déplacement Europe et hors zone Europe (équivalent 1 mois par an)




Envie de structurer un référentiel produit robuste au cœur des enjeux industriels ? Échangeons !

Show more
HTML:
Gestionnaire de Données de Stocks / Master Data Analyst


Dans un contexte de transformation, notre client du secteur industriel recherche un(e) Gestionnaire de Données de Stocks / Master Data Analyst pour structurer, fiabiliser et piloter la gestion du cycle de vie des données produits.


Votre rôle :

Véritable point de contact entre les équipes métiers (Supply, Production, Maintenance) et les équipes IT, vous serez garant(e) de la qualité et de la cohérence des données diverses : articles, stocks, fournisseurs, …

Vous intervenez sur la création, la mise à jour, le nettoyage, la migration des données et participerez à l’optimisation des processus.

Vous travaillez en transversal avec les fonctions opérationnelles et informatiques, pilotez la refonte d’outils internes, définissez des KPIs qualité et contribuez activement à l’amélioration continue.

Vous assurez également la gestion administrative liée à la logistique, aux achats et au suivi documentaire, en lien avec les opérations de la société.


Votre profil :

  • Bachelor (gestion industrielle, data management, Supply Chain)
  • 3 ans d’expérience en environnement industriel
  • Vous maîtrisez les outils IT en tant qu’utilisateur avancé : ERP (SAP), requêtes SQL, Excel (niveau avancé) et idéalement Power BI pour l’analyse et le reporting.
  • Bilingue Français / Anglais


Informations complémentaires :

  • Taux d’occupation à 100%
  • 5 jours par semaine sur site (pas de home office)
  • Déplacement Europe et hors zone Europe (équivalent 1 mois par an)

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Quantitative Analyst (all)
Description:
BKW offers forward-looking total solutions in the areas of energy, buildings and infrastructure - internationally and in partnership. With around 12,000 employees, we build modern grids, generate renewable energy and realise energy-efficient buildings. We are looking for passionate people to join us in making a contribution to the society and environment of tomorrow. Become part of the BKW network and join us in creating living spaces worth living in!
 

Quantitative Analyst (all)
 

Risk Management

80-100%

Join our risk management team and play a key role in ensuring market data integrity and advancing risk metrics in energy trading. As a self-motivated professional with strong analytical skills, you will contribute to the continuous development of our risk management strategies.
 

Your role

Ensure the integrity of market data and maintain external data interfaces and contracts
Enhance market risk metrics for commodities, FX, and interest rate markets
Conduct stress tests on trading portfolios and monitor risk limits, escalating breaches when necessary
Oversee and improve risk reporting processes to support decision-making
Work closely with trading units to analyze market developments and assess risks
Contribute to operational risk management by handling event reporting and training new employees

 

Your skills

Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative discipline; CFA or FRM is a plus
Experience in risk management, energy trading, or banking
Knowledge of financial mathematics and market risk assessment
Experience in energy markets or trading with programming skills (Matlab, SQL, .NET, Python)
Analytical and systematic thinking with a practical affinity for reporting and databases
Proficiency in German and English

 

Questions about the application process

Florian Witschi

Recruiting Partner

florian.witschi@bkw.ch

Clemens Mair

Head of Risk Markets & Analytics

clemens.mair@bkw.ch

We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

Apply online at bkw.com/jobs
 

Show more
